chapter.name: Sidebar: Scorepions
chapter.p: A plugin system called Scorepions allows Max programmers to create patches extending the functionality of the MaxScore/LiveScore editors.

The Scorepions currently included in the MaxScore package are:
Accent Threshold Transform
Amplitude Crescendo Transform
Amplitude to Dynamics Transform
Artificial Harmonic Transform
Augmentation-Diminuation Transform
Chord to Melody Transform
Create Click Track
Diatonic Transposition Transform
DJster Autobus-Scorepion
Double Below Transform
Dynamics To Amplitude Transform
Enharmonic Spelling Transform
Fill Empty Measures with Rests
Fix Issues
Inversion Transform
Markov Operator
Melody to Chord Transform
Move Track Transform
Retrograde Transform
Scramble Transform
Scrolling Score Creator
Serial Transform
Text To Picster Transform
Zipper Transform
Selecting a Scorepions from the menu on top will load the Scorepion from disk which displays the instructions as to how to use it and its GUI elements.
We will now discuss how to create a Scorepion based on the Scorepion Template patch which can be open by clicking on the Open Tutorial button in this window's upper right-hand side

p.i: Scorepion, expanded and in Edit mode.

chapter.p: Scorepions to be included in the Scorepion menu need to reside in "MaxScore Lib/Scorepions". This Scorepion is based on "Fill Empty Measures with Rest" and serves as an annotated template.

h4.span: A Scorepion uses the grab object to receive info queries from the host. When the MaxScore Editor receives a message starting with sendScorepion from a Max patch it's embedded in all of its attributes are sent to the currently loaded Scorepion, e.g. "sendScorepion bang". Send all messages to the MaxScore Editor via the outlet.
